abstract: Stiff competition at India's top colleges is pushing students to the United States.
snippet: Stiff competition at India's top colleges is pushing students to the United States.
lead_paragraph: "Moulshri Mohan was an excellent student at one of the top private high schools in New Delhi," writes Nida Najar in this New York Times article about a surge in Indian students applying to American colleges."When she applied to colleges, she received scholarship offers of $20,000 from Dartmouth and $15,000 from Smith. Her pile of acceptance letters would have made any ambitious teenager smile: Cornell, Bryn Mawr, Duke, Wesleyan, Barnard and the University of Virginia.

headline.main: Can't Get into D.U.? Try an Ivy League
